channel.title: Opinions on RoR
channel.description:
I know there are some RoR users out there. What are your biggest gripes? I've started delving into it more recently and I find it difficult to understand the scope across the different components of the application. I have about 2 years of Ruby experience but it's still pretty confusing seeing as most of what goes on in the background is hidden from you.
What have you used it for? What do you hate about it? All that jazz.

item.title: Opinions on RoR
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:14, topic:542491”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=661368.msg4421190#msg4421190 date=1398530858]

I’ve found if you use scaffolding when you first start you’ll have a hard time figuring out what’s what. My biggest problem isn’t specific to RoR, but its getting in the mindset of MVCs.

Scaffolding is not meant for production use. It’s used to get the application bootstrapped quickly so I hear. I haven’t checked if it still produces redundant code, if somebody want’s to correct me on that. I know that the default rails scaffolding is crap.
[/quote]
Of course you aren’t meant to stick a generic scaffold out there for everyone to use. It does save a lot of the heavy lifting when you first start, which is exactly what it is designed for. As far as the code it generates being DRY, that is something heavily debated in the RoR community.

Those blog rants you are reading saying scaffolding is bad are dated and rarely exist for 4.x[/quote]
Actually I found something up to date, I’ll talk about it later with you

item.title: Opinions on RoR
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Mopman:

What do you find is hidden from you?

Rack wasn’t explained very well along with some of the methods to access the request/headers and also specifics on creating middleware (Like if I wanted to create a custom authorization middleware). To add, properly sanitizing post data felt strange along with error handling. I had to look at how the pipeline was built to really fully understand rack Feels like a bit of a barrier for people trying to get into it, be technical with it. Now it’s not much of an issue, but it was 1-2 weeks ago.

Besides that, I love most of the features (ActiveRecord, Routing, etc).
